title: Lynda- Running a Design Business: Pricing and Estimating
description:
Running a Design Business: Pricing and Estimating
1h 5m Appropriate for all Nov 14, 2013

Do you know what to charge for your design services? Too much and you risk scaring away potential clients; too little and you're not compensating yourself properly. Let Terry Lee Stone, a design manager who's priced thousands of design projects, show you how to calculate your work's true worth. She explains how to keep good records, set an hourly rate, create estimates then transform them into contracts, and successfully approach financial matters with your clients. Plus, like all the other courses in the Running a Design Business series, this course includes free worksheetsÃ¢â‚¬â€including templates for evaluating your expenses and calculating your fees.
Topics include:

    Thinking about money
    Factors to consider when pricing design
    Comparing time-based vs. component-based pricing strategies
    Scoping a project
    Determining your rate based on factors like industry standards and budget
    Creating estimates
    Communicating additional costs
    Invoicing the client
